Package projects

Class ProjectsApp

java.lang.Object
projects.ProjectsApp
public class ProjectsApp extends Object
This is the driver class for a menu-driven application allowing the user to perform CRUD operations on a MySQL database that stores information about various DIY projects.
Author:
ProjectGrantwood

  • Field Details

      private projects.service.ProjectService projectService
      Used to access the service layer of the application.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProjectsApp

      public ProjectsApp()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The entry-point for the menu-driven application.
      Parameters:
      args - included for compatibility, unused.

    • processUserSelections

      private void processUserSelections()
      Manages user selections, as well as monitoring if the menu-driven application is still running. Prints any Exception to the terminal with some additional text.

    • deleteProject

      private void deleteProject()
      Allows the user to select a project to delete. Includes an additional prompt for them to verify that they want to delete the project. If the project to be deleted has the same projectId as the curProject class variable, sets curProject to null .

    • updateProjectDetails

      private void updateProjectDetails()
      Guides the user through each column in the curProject class variable, allowing them to input new values for each. Does so by creating a new Project instance and assigning it either the updated values, or copies them from the curProject object if the user does not provide a new value. If the transaction with the SQL database is successful, fetches the the project row from the database with ProjectService.fetchProjectbyId, which populates a new Project object with that data, and assigns it to the curProject class variable.

    • viewSelectedProjectDetails

      private void viewSelectedProjectDetails()
      Prints the selected project to the terminal. The selected project is held in the curProject class variable. In cases where there is no project selected, an additional message guides the user toward the menu item where they can select a project.

    • selectProject

      private void selectProject()
      Sets the value of the curProject class variable based on project data retrieved from the table. Requires the user to input a valid projectId after printing a list of projects to the by calling printProjects.

    • createProject

      private void createProject()
      Creates a Project instance and moves the user through populating its fields with a series of prompts.

    • getValidDifficulty

      private Integer getValidDifficulty(boolean allowNull)
      Obtains an Integer value representing project difficulty from the user. If the value is not betweeen 1-5 inclusive, re-prompts the user with a marginally more helpful message.
      Parameters:
      allowNull - To be passed down to getIntInput(), as well as the validity check. Specifies if null input is allowed.
      Returns:
      an Integer that's valid given the constraints.

    • checkForValidityOfDifficultyInput

      private boolean checkForValidityOfDifficultyInput(Integer difficulty, boolean allowNull)
      Tests that an Integer is between 1 and 5 inclusive, or null, if the appropriate parameter is set to true.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The Integer being tested. allowNull accept null input as valid.
      Returns:
      true if input is null (if allowNull is true) OR between 1 and 5 inclusive, otherwise false.

    • getUserSelection

      private int getUserSelection()
      Prints the available operations, obtains the user selection, and handles cases where the user instructs the program to continue without providing an input.
      Returns:
      The user-provided input, or -1 if no input is given.

    • getIntInput

      private Integer getIntInput(String prompt, boolean allowNull)
      Attempts to convert user input (obtained by getStringInput) to an Integer and handles cases where the input is null.
      Parameters:
      prompt - For display to the user, passed to getStringInput
      allowNull - If blank input is valid, this boolean prevents a NullPointerException from being thrown.
      Returns:
      value of prompt, or null.

    • getStringInput

      private String getStringInput(String prompt)
      Prints the given prompt to the terminal, then obtains the user input by reading the terminal's next line. Trims the input, and handles cases where no input is given.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt to print.
      Returns:
      The trimmed input, or null.

    • getDecimalInput

      private BigDecimal getDecimalInput(String prompt, boolean allowNull)
      Tries to convert user input to a BigDecimal.
      Parameters:
      prompt - Shown to the user before obtaining the input.
      allowNull - If blank input is valid, this boolean prevents a NullPointerException from being thrown.
      Returns:
      the user input as a BigDecimal.

    • printOperations

      private void printOperations()
      Prints the contents of the operations field using a StringBuilder instance. Performs some formatting.

    • printProjects

      private void printProjects()
      Prints the contents of the operations field to the terminal using human-readable formatting. Additionally prepends a message prompting the user to pick from those selections.
